rev.comment: Replaceable fair use image. Living person.
rev.diff:
Line 22: Line 22:
He has made over 55 film and TV appearances since 1959 but his career was at its peak in the 1960s. He became known for his performances in gangster or [[western film]]s in the 1960s where he typically portrayed a bandit or mercenary. His dark features, similar to those of his Italian co-stars meant that he could play Latin characters, such as Mexicans.
He has made over 55 film and TV appearances since 1959 but his career was at its peak in the 1960s. He became known for his performances in gangster or [[western film]]s in the 1960s where he typically portrayed a bandit or mercenary. His dark features, similar to those of his Italian co-stars meant that he could play Latin characters, such as Mexicans.

[[Image:Sieghardt Rupp.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Sieghardt Rupp as Estaban Rojo in ''[[A Fistful of Dollars]]'' (1964)]]
 
His most noted western performance was his role as Estaban Rojo in [[Sergio Leone]]'s 1964 production ''[[A Fistful of Dollars]]'' alongside [[Clint Eastwood]] and [[Gian Maria VolontÃ¨]]. He appeared in many other westerns in the 1960s such as ''[[Blood at Sundown]]'' (1966) although he appeared in the romantic adventure ''[[Angelique and the Sultan]]'' in 1968.
